name: Creating Internet Gateway
description: Walkthrough on creating a Internet Gateway.

steps.message: In order to let your instances have internet access an Internet Gateway or a NAT gateway must be created. In this tutorial we will show you how to create a Internet Gateway.

Click the menu button on top left. Scroll down to "Networking" and click "Virtual Cloud Networks".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/vcnmenu.png}}
Choose the VCN you wish to add subnets. Under Resources, Click Internet Gateway, then Create Internet Gateway. </br> {{img-url:/images/tutorials/vcnig.png}}
Give a name for the Internet Gateway, and choose the compartment. Click Create Internet Gateway. </br>{{img-url:/images/tutorials/vcnig2.png}}

In order to use an Internet Gateway you must add it to your Route Table. Under Resources, Click Route Table. Click the route table name. Tip: The default route table is created on initial VCN creation.

Click Edit Route Rules. Under Target Type choose Internet Gateway. For destination CIDR block give 0.0.0.0/0, then choose your IG from before under Target Internet Gateway. </br> {{img-url:/images/tutorials/vcnigcreation.png}}
Now your resources will have access to the internet and you can SSH and connect to your compute instances!
